name: biomni-analyze-atp-luminescence-assay
title: Biomni: Analyze ATP Luminescence Assay
content:
Overview

This pathology analysis tool quantifies ATP (adenosine triphosphate) concentration from luminescence-based assays. The tool processes raw luminescence readings, applies standard curve calibration, and normalizes ATP levels to provide accurate measurements of cellular metabolic activity and viability.

Input Parameters

  • data_file (required): Path to the luminescence data file containing sample measurements
  • standard_curve_file (required): Path to the standard curve calibration data file
  • normalization_method (optional): Method for normalizing ATP values - options include 'cell_count', 'protein', or 'none' (default: 'cell_count')
  • normalization_data (optional): Normalization factors or metadata for sample-specific corrections

Biological Use Case

ATP luminescence assays are critical for assessing cellular metabolism, viability, and function in various research and clinical contexts. Applications include drug toxicity screening, mitochondrial dysfunction analysis in metabolic disorders, cancer cell metabolism studies, and quality control in cell therapy manufacturing. This tool is particularly valuable for high-throughput screening of compounds affecting cellular energetics and for monitoring cell health in tissue engineering applications.

Output

The analysis produces calibrated ATP concentrations for each sample, normalized values based on the selected method, quality control metrics, and statistical summaries. Output includes concentration curves, comparative plots, and tabulated data suitable for publication and regulatory submission.

Category

pathology
